Participant Gina: Your Response:

The sun is actually **white** when viewed from space.  

Our atmosphere scatters shorter wavelengths of light, like blue, more effectively. This is why the sky appears blue and the sun appears yellow to us on Earth. Without that atmosphere to filter the light, the sun's true color, white, is revealed. 





Participant Aaron: Your Response:
Gina is absolutely right! 

It's fascinating how our perception of color can be so different depending on our environment. I always thought the sun looked yellow, even when I looked at pictures from space. It makes you realize how much our atmosphere influences what we see.
